documents.document: @nzfatmatt hopefully added to the atmosphere of the location
Interview on our southern world record, with @SusieFergusonNZ & @radionz, from the southern ocean: https://t.co/nfpjshf4lz #RossSeaTrip
@Karina_Joy you mean residents or their guests? Who would that be?
@Karina_Joy we're going to see what the weather, time and track line into Chch gives us
@vsvictory thanks. Btw, being interviewed by National Radio over satellite tmrw at 8.50am about our furtherest South ship record!
@vsvictory we're a small team that creates private charters to polar regions under EYOS Expeditions. If you hv a private ship, we can help
@vsvictory me personally? Assistant expedition leader, lecturer and zodiac driver...?
Ordered my zodiac passengers to abandon ship last week, they were very happy to comply! #RossSeaTrip, Antarctica https://t.co/yDvSUxPv6L
@Karina_Joy yes it has been remarkable. Though the calm weather meant Cape Royds/Evans are still in fast ice & we missed them unfortunately
@farmerjase thanks. Just my iPhone ones too. Just sailing back from far side of Ross Sea tonight. We're closer to Argentina than NZ at mo!
Would be the 1st humans to have ever walked here, Barlett Bay, Cape Colbeck, Antarctica #RossSeaTrip https://t.co/0IFZdjzuyB
Freezing cold today at Barlett Bay, in a freezing cold corner of the Ross Sea #RossSeaTrip https://t.co/wctP82La8Z
@hottriggered I've seen a few seals in my time & this has to rate as the most strikingly beautiful.
WOW! Spotted my first Ross Seal today after 18 trips to Antarctica. Seen by so few people. So little known about it… https://t.co/bKKD5EoCK4
Setting off to cut an ice landing staircase into the southern most piece of coast in the world, Bay of Whales, Antarctica #RossSeaTrip
Standby for world record attempt at the southern most vessel EVER, later today #RossSeaTrip https://t.co/G7bOQy8EZu
Into the Bay of Whales, always hoping to set a furtherest South record for a ship #RossSeaTrip https://t.co/H3J7AoCmUY
Sitting having a brew, watching the Ross Ice-shelf slide past the window; the odd Emperor penguin too. #RossSeaTrip
@shebaandkate has all the prerequisites for polar work, looks good on paper
@pv_reynolds @pv_reynolds flippers back and striding out. Right foot down behind the bristle tail
@lukeappleby not of that sorry
@lukeappleby large colony nearby. Some just use us as a landing site, & sometimes a refuge from predators. Happened 10x y'day. They hop out
Unexpected passenger, Franklin Island, #RossSeaTrip, Antarctica https://t.co/naSZ2oHwbv
What a terrible day to be Kayaking in Terra Nova Bay, Antarctica, around blue icebergs. #RossSeaTrip https://t.co/0QQlozj97k
@vaughndavis sure is. Into Mario Zuccelli base tomorrow. Perhaps we'll get their signature stealthy low pass over the ship in a twin otter
Drygalski Ice Tongue is a 92km long floating glacier in Antarctica. A 1/2km x 30m face collapsed before us today. I… https://t.co/IS1pxUcWnH
Another day mucking around in boats. Bless. #RossSeaTrip Antarctica https://t.co/QM9bUhcuzK
@Brycepearce serious question? Background knowledge, experience, skill set & any extra 'bonus' skills. Give me a call in a fortnight
@Brycepearce another blue sky day today. Soon to get my zodiac amongst the Drygalski ice tongue, one of world's longest floating glaciers
Couldn't be happier than a boy with a boat amongst the pack ice. 2 emperor penguins found. Smoko time. #RossSeaTrip https://t.co/XekChotwNe
Pushing pack ice. #RossSeaTrip Antarctica https://t.co/GsaJauLoO7
Driving my zodiac at midnight, under Mt Herschel, #RossSeaTrip Antarctica. Sir Ed climbed it in '67 I believe https://t.co/JvnfnHoPDK
Yeah nah, good to be back in the Ross Sea. Adelies for Africa #RossSeaTrip https://t.co/xVVhtdhGkV
Back at Cape Adare, Ross Sea, Antarctica. Home to the 1st dwelling on a continent. Can't wait to start driving zodi… https://t.co/e3iHR4dWM6
@brenakiwi Yes. A path less travelled. I've been past a few times, but never seen them in the fog or snow storms before
The Balleny Islands, 2000km south of NZ. Midnight last night - our last sunset for a while #Antarctica. #RossSeaTrip https://t.co/T05PYDmXVm
Dilemma - passing one of the most remote island chains in the world, stay up all night or get sleep? #RossSeaTrip https://t.co/vdoN3FXU2a
Just arrived at the Balleny Islands, 2000km south of New Zealand #RossSeaTrip https://t.co/xhAHsYNKLy
@farmgeek I'm deep in the southern ocean, below 60 degrees, and we haven't even seen that much yet!
Check out our Southwards journey to the Ross Sea Antarctica https://t.co/amwBAv607x #RossSeaTrip https://t.co/EAPTArVwxQ
Looks like I'm going to have a go at underwater ROV piloting. Add that to my lever twiddling excavator & drone flyi… https://t.co/D4bSzVhf6Z
We're heading out of Hobart, Ross Sea Antarctica next stop #RossSeaTrip https://t.co/SYS0kR3r04
@SusieFergusonNZ good to hear
Been blowing its proverbials off in Hobart. Feels like home. #RossSeaTrip
@agwomanchelsea sorry I meant which ship/company. Who was your EL?
@SusieFergusonNZ how did the camping go?
@LilyLivingstone have you told her about social media hinges?
@agwomanchelsea who were you with? And more to the point, did you find Ramos Generales cafe/deli in Ushuaia?
Pretty cool, I'm in Oz, but the wild rabbits at the farm keep emailing me #robsfarm https://t.co/SzRYNtvyWl
@KevDaly yip, and the ship's booking agent pays top $ for flights too I see. @airnz
@KevDaly scrub that, jst found bloody @airnz hv unilaterally decided to dishonor seamans books 4 months ago. +$120 to get a bag to Melb
@kimi_collins what species of pickle is it?
@Toa5t obviously full of confidence fresh from their success in getting Mexico to pay for the wall
@KevDaly logs time at sea/position & if you're travelling to or from a ship overseas you normally get 40kgs & extra bag with it
'Seaman's discharge book', perennial source of mirth for some #RossSeaTrip https://t.co/jnWbUT6ktT
Last kiwi dunner before the Ross Sea journey, fush and chups on Petone Beach with an IPA. Perfect
@pestproof @mecha_genki related to one of our incredible native versions we found in Taranaki once: https://t.co/POotfLZKhk
@warnersl 1) obligatory for visitors I think? 2) u can never take going to the Ross Sea too seriously no? Lkg forward seeing everyone again
@warnersl Hobart on Sunday I believe. How's Australia been treating you?
@AlastairJNZ thanks. Bloody Instagram ruins a perfectly good in camera crop too though ;-> @NZGeographic
@JMulliganRNZ did I just hear there was a fire at Jesse Point on Rat Peak in Queenstown?! You writing the news too?
@LachlanForsyth back on the Tele! That didn't take long
@PolarKimbo off to the Ross Sea with you I see next week. This is becoming way too regular, people might talk
@Brycepearce very thought provoking read and very challenging for some
NZ, on the road to becoming the Detroit of agriculture? Do some thinking about this: https://t.co/buNvFgMNQE
New Singapore Airlines flight to Canberra out of Wellington sure makes itself known just now
Check out SmartStart, new Govt initiative to merge multi-dept contacts into a one stop shop. Smart work: https://t.co/4pxtg2XXve
@sarabeee I think my Elna does that and a few others ;->
@hochylora not to mention copyright @petapixel
@kiwinerd interesting to know, I use 'snell's window' regularly in photography: https://t.co/LuBE9vXCJo @FeyHag
@brenakiwi boycott them. I have to pay staff for not even working & then pay cafes' surcharges too. Should factor it into costs annually
@blairdrysdale77 good to hear. Many seem to hv bought the media/SM story that 2016 was bad; #Lemmings
2016 wasn't a shit year. I had a flippin' top year, & so did most of you I suspect. Have a top 2017 also. Kia ora tatou
@GrowFromHereNZ happened to a friend on the picton ferry once. Destroyed the leather inside of their Damlier. Only time she saw her dad cry
@macgibbons thanks. Don't think we'll even make it that far. Big day thru Molesworth & Rainbow Road. Will be good to be home to bed
@LilyLivingstone it's a sign
@macgibbons we passed on the Strait I see. All the best for 2017
Off to the Ross Sea in a few weeks, but there looks like a lot of sea ice about still. Hmm https://t.co/yCLhd9N8sP #Antarctica
@matteastnz I should've parked the jeep in front and gone for a peaceful tramp
@matteastnz tempting. DOC nds to consider whether it's appropriate to hv jetskis in a pristine alpine lake enjoyed for wilderness values
@teradar yes, my brother owns one, and he just happens to deliver the 9m old products of aforementioned organs too. All bases covered
@Olivefarmer very true. Can't remember what Winston had to do with it, was he onboard?
@hariata it's actually a kids titanic slide, but yeah
@hariata all about him, to hell with the trampers and tourists enjoying the serenity
Picton knows a good New Years party, complete with Wahine reenactment. Awkward https://t.co/FmWcjXoJ3Y
Turn up at remote beautiful wild Lake Tennyson this morning, & some Audi driver decides to hell with peace & tranqu… https://t.co/2w5wGkSEE9
@E2NZ check all the DOC science and research series papers online, they should be in there. I used to commission it. @DolphinEnc
@E2NZ plenty of tightly managed restrictions, including a daily no interaction period based on research relevant to area/species @DolphinEnc
Out looking for dolphins off #Kaikoura early this morning with @DolphinEnc. Open for business since #eqnz https://t.co/His58yu8qB
@BR3NDA what would you expect after compulsory military indoctrination, free thinking? @LostArcNZ @nz_voter @SirWB
@RexWiderstrom exactly. Organic milk powder $15k/tonne, ours $2-3k/t. Cld hv wealthy farmers healthy land @ShayneCurrieNZH @RFStew @nzherald
@RexWiderstrom the real strategic error was not hdg for high value organic less intensive 10yrs ago. @ShayneCurrieNZH @RFStew @nzherald
@Brycepearce I don't think the EPA is compliant with the USA anymore
@babye can we send a couple of German girls your way? We had them hardcore camping on Molesworth last night so they… https://t.co/NLozlJJFnH
100% pure NZ. Warming up the 2 stroke in pristine Nelson Lakes National Park, gassing the tourists enjoying the pea… https://t.co/OcJFsk7CDV
@TeamTottie Was hoping to come up via Molesworth in a week or so but Awatere valley still blocked. Prob won't come yr way now
@Olivefarmer was hoping to, bt doesn't seem Awatere valley Rd will be open for ages? Which means Rainbow Rd home @TeamTottie @DougAvery12
@DrSeaRotmann she's great
@tockly you're onto it
@simon_pleasants I wish it were that simple. We've been hvg problems for months, made worse by Xmas. We still hv to run a business. @nzpost
